intro: Callista parishii, commonly known as the Parry's callista, is a species of flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, commonly known as the daisy or sunflower family. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flower heads that are surrounded by pale green ray florets. It typically grows in coastal areas and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Callista parishii is a perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to 1 meter.
